body: +1 This change is ok to me.

@liming01 - you are correct, because HAWQ doesn't support indexes, this work has the same limitation. All the spatial operation tests completed successfully, with the exception of spatial indexes and UPDATEs.
@kdunn926, if spatial index can not support, then the query performance will be very slow.  What we can offer will be far away from user's expectation. Need to think a workaround.
@liming01, agreed, performance will not be optimal without indexes. I believe there is value in this PR regardless, until [HAWQ-303](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HAWQ-303) is implemented.
@linwen @ictmalili please help to review and comment, thanks.
+1, Yi could you please tell us the failure case before? I think the failure case can help us to determine the EPSILON
@wcl14 I think this has been committed, right? If yes, please close this PR. Thanks
@xunzhang What's the purpose of this PR?
@ictmalili I separate the positive cases into sanity schedule for hawq register. Other cases should be separated further.
Please Create a JIRA before checkin. Otherwise, +1
I thought adding a case, but it seems that it is hard to add one in the current framework.
ok, maybe we could test it manually for this.
There might be some problems with this modification: you add a `int64` type of guc value into a `config_int` option list. @wengyanqing
+1 for external table bucket number change.
To conclude, I think there needs no modification according to @paul-guo- 's review. Please check out my replies and review this pull request again @paul-guo- . Thanks!

I'm a bit concerned about the impact of removing this function parseDelimiterChar completely without completely understand the impact of it w.r.t Partition filtering. Lets merge this change once we verify that Partition based filtering works fine with all the Hive related profiles
So the delimiter we were previously explicitly asking for in the DDL will just be retrieved internally?
@shivzone, @kavinderd I double checked for HiveRc and HiveText - they still need delimiter, which should be exposed to users, so in this PR I just removed DELIMITER for HiveOrc profile.
@sansanichfb please provide some context in the Jira even though its a subtask
You could also have queries using only fragmenter, accessor and resolver classes and no profile defined, hope that doesn't affect this flow ?
ORCA did ACL check in their code also so please make sure your batch code works for them also.

Seems there are file conflicts with https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/pull/1046

At least rangerrest.h

Revert this commit because running installcheck-good failed.
It is my fault, I had thought that we have move all testcases in installcheck-good to featuretest, so I only ran feature test.

Need more time to investigate why it conflict at the same relation file number.

When we found the same error table used for the same query, we should assign a new sets of seg files for INSERT INTO ERROR TABLE, which means different relation will insert into the different sets of segfiles.
Hi guys, please see the comments in the JIRA.

+1 

One trivial comment about output int64 or unsigned int64 data, I think it is better to use INT64_FORMAT and UINT64_FORMAT instead of %lld. Though this is not actually involved in your fix.

I agree with you. @jinyismilodon 
I've fix the code accordingly.
